lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin min ko cmqkwr vwrau ssIAr sUr kot kotin pRgws jI
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Mani Ko Chamatakaar Vaarau , Saseear Soor Kot Kotani Pragaas Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Shine of millions and millions of gems and pearls, light of countless Suns and Moons, are paltry and worthy of sacrifice over the obedient Sikh whose forehead is able to kiss the dust of the feet of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: kotin kotwin Bwig pUrn pRqwp Cib jigmig joiq hY sujs invws jI
lines.transliteration_english: Kotani Kotaani Bhaagi Pooran Prataap Chhabi , Jagimagi Joti Hai Sujas Nivaas Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of millions of fortunate people and the glow of supreme honour is trivial before the beautiful sheen of the forehead that has acquired the dust of the feet of the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: isv snkwid bHmwidk mnorQ kY qIrQ kotwin kot bwCq hY qws jI
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sanakaadi Brahamaadik Manorad Kai , Teerad Kotaani Kot Baachhat Hai Taas Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Shiv Ji, the four sons of Brahma (Sanak etc.), Brahma himself, that is the three prime gods of Hindu pantheon crave for the glorious dust of the True Guru's feet. Countless places of pilgrimage also long for this dust.

lines.gurmukhi: msqik drsn soBw ko mhwqm AgwiD boD sRI gur crn rj mwqR lwgY jws jI ]421]
lines.transliteration_english: Masataki Darasan Sobhaa Ko Mahaatam Agaadhi Bodha , Sree Gur Charan Raj Maatr Laagai Jaas Jee ?421?

Shabad OS B.translation: The forehead that acquires a small amount of dust of the lotus feet of the True Guru, the glory of his glimpse is beyond description.  (421)
